## Quarto ‚ûù many outputs {background-image="images/quarto-to-docs.png"}

With Quarto you can weave together narrative text and code to produce elegantly formatted output as documents, web pages, blog posts, books, and more...

## Installing Quarto

Best Approach:

 - Go to the [Quarto website and download!](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/)

## Quarto version

::: callout-tip
Run the following in your Terminal to find your Quarto version:

``` {.bash filename="Terminal"}
quarto --version
```
:::

# Quarto Documents

## Documents

 - Lots of options `.pdf`, `.html`, `.docx`
 - Easiest to start with `.html`!
 - We can embed our code and figures with the text!
 - Click "`Render`" = AutoMagically make a report!

## Let's Make One!

**Download and Open [`csci-summary.qmd`]() in RStudio and‚Ä¶**

1. `Render` the document.
2. Replace the name with your own and re-`render`.
3. Inspect the parts of the document and change something else or add some new text. Re-`Render`!
4. Compare with your neighbor and find what they did!

## Making a Document

:::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
1. In RStudio, File > New File > Quarto Document
2. Add a Title, and keep everything else as a default, then click `Create`!
3. We can always change things later
:::
::: {.column width="10%"}
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}

![](../images/new_quarto.png)
:::
::::

## The `yaml` header (METADATA)

```
---
title: "CSCI Summary"
format: html

execute: 
  echo: true
---
```

 - This needs to go at the top of our document
 - It provides info about what format our document will take
 - There are [LOTS of options](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/html-basics.html)

# Dashboard basics

## Cards {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-easing="ease-in-out"}

Dashboards are composed of **cards**.

:::::: r-hstack

## Rows and columns {auto-animate="true" auto-animate-easing="ease-in-out"}

Cards are arranged into **rows** and **columns**.
